title: The Dutch Revolt 2TTO
description: Interactive assignment about the Dutch Revolt and Eighty Years' War.

items.content:
Dear students,

The Dutch Revolt, also known as the Eighty Years' War, is a very important moment in our Dutch history. During this time the Dutch fought for their independence whilst their economy thrived.

Their battle against the Spanish king ended in an independent republic, moving into the so called 'Golden Age'. But what happened exactly in this time of war in the the sixteenth and seventeenth century?

This assignment discusses the most important events and introduces you to the most influencial historical figures of that time. Not only will you understand what caused the Dutch Revolt and this Eigthy Years' War, but you will also be able to describe the most important events which happened during the Revolt and why it resulted in the start of the Dutch Republic.

Step 1 and 2 are individual work. Step 3 up until 5 will be completed in pairs.
You will have six lessons and homework time to work on this assignment before you have to hand in your final product in Google Classroom.

Our tips before you start this assignment?

- Always write down the sources you have used (source annotation);

- Write your texts in your own words;

- Check regulary with your teacher if your choices are well considered and if your progress is sufficient.


Have fun, good luck and 'break a leg'!

Mr. Kamsteeg

Ms. van der Steijle

Mr. van der Pijl

Ms. de Goede

1) WHO? Individually

2) WHAT? Complete these three exercises.

3) HOW?

a) Click on the activities, read the instruction(s) and continue by clicking on 'start'.
b) Finished? Copy or make a screenshot of your (corrected) results and paste them into your 'The Dutch Revolt' Google Document.

header.title: Chronological order of events - Part I

introduction.body:
Please match the names of theze important historical figures with the correct short biographies by using the drag-and-drop principle.

If you are finished and you think you have the correct matches, please make a printscreen and copy your results into your personal 'Dutch Revolt' Google Document in Google Classroom.

prompt.body: Please place the times and events in the correct chronological order by the drag-and-drop principle.

content.body: She was Queen of England and Ireland from 17 November 1558 until her death. Sometimes called The Virgin Queen, Gloriana or Good Queen Bess, the childless queen was the fifth and last monarch of the Tudor dynasty. The period of her reign is famous for the flourishing of English drama, led by playwrights such as William Shakespeare and Christopher Marlowe. Some historians depict her as a short-tempered, sometimes indecisive ruler. Towards the end of her reign, a series of economic and military problems weakened her popularity.

He was called "the Prudent" (el Prudente), was King of Spain[a] (1556-98), King of Portugal (1581-98, as Philip I, Filipe I), King of Naples and Sicily (both from 1554), and during his marriage to Queen Mary I (1554-58) jure uxoris King of England and Ireland. He was also Duke of Milan. From 1555, he was lord of the Seventeen Provinces of the Netherlands. He governed Spain in her so-called "Golden Age". However, his reign saw the economic decline of Spain, her bankruptcy and a disastrous decade from 1588 to 1598 which included the disaster of the Spanish Armada. He considered himself to be a traditional Spanish man - he had a love of music and art.

She was Governor of the Netherlands from 1559 to 1567[1] and from 1578 to 1582. She was the illegitimate daughter of the then 22-year-old Holy Roman Emperor Charles V. She was a Duchess of Florence and a Duchess of Parma and Piacenza by marriage. In 1555, she left Italy for the Netherlands, where she left her son in the care of her half-brother Philip II. Like her aunts who trained her, she had many abilities. Philip II appointed her Governor of the Netherlands when he left them in 1559 for Spain.

This Dutch nobleman was born in the German county of Nassau. The first years of his life he lived with his protestant family, but than he had to move to Brussels because Charles V demanded a Catholic upbringing. He was married for the first time in 1551, to the eighteen-year-old Anna van Buren, the daughter of a rich nobleman. He became an important advisor to the emperor Charles V.

He was ruler of both the Spanish Empire from 1516 and the Holy Roman Empire from 1519, as well as of Habsburg Netherlands from 1506. He voluntarily stepped down from these and other positions by a series of abdications between 1554 and 1556. Through inheritance, he brought together under his rule extensive territories in western, central, and southern Europe, and the Spanish colonies in the Americas and Asia.

He belonged to one of the most powerful families in Europe. His nickname was 'The Iron Duke' and he was a Spanish noble, general, and diplomat. He is considered the best general of his generation by some historians. Although a tough leader, he was respected by his troops.

items.content:
1) WHO? Individually

2) WHAT?

a) You will work on four research questions related to the Dutch Revolt:

  1. What were the underlying causes which resulted in the start of the the Dutch Revolt? Describe three underlying causes.
  2. What was the direct cause of the Dutch Revolt? Describe this event and explain why this was the direct cause.
  3. Statement: "A better name for the Eighty Years War would be The Dutch Revolt." Argue why you agree or disagree with this statement.
  4. Explain why the Dutch provinces eventually became a Republic instead of a monarchy, like most countries in Europe were in those days. Make clear how the provinces came to this decision.

b) Answer the research questions after conducting your own research.

3) HOW?

a) You work in the 'Dutch Revolt' Google Document in Google Classroom.

b) SEARCH for information to find the answers to your questions.

c) Tips: use keywords / use more than one source / maybe use 'history for kids' / be aware of who and when your source was written

d) WRITE in your own words.

e) Use source ANNOTATION.

f) CHECK your writing once you think you are finished. (correct language, spelling, grammar mistakes)

1) WHO? You and a classmate

2) WHAT?

a) Use the list of events from Step 1 of the assignment.

b) Choose one event to describe in more detail.

3) HOW?

a) CHOOSE an event and CHECK with your teacher is your choice is OK.

b) SEARCH for information about this event.

c) Tips: use keywords / use more than one source / maybe use 'history for kids' / be aware of who and when your source was written.

d) Work in the 'Dutch Revolt' Google Document you have been working in all this time.

e) DESCRIBE your chosen event in your own words. Answer questions like "When? Where? Who? Why? How?". Make sure that you describe the event from different points of view. For example: Philip II might experience things differently conpared to his halfsister Margaretha of Parma.

g) Use source ANNOTATION

1) WHO? You and a classmate

2) WHAT? Create two different profiles related to the event you choose in step 3.

3) HOW?

a) You both choose one person for whom you will create a profile. Make sure these persons (or characters) are on opposite sides of each other.

b) The profile is made in the 'Dutch Revolt' document in google classroom.

c) Both profiles describe the general and personal information of an important historical figure or group who were involved in you chosen/given event.

d) If you are not sure you have chosen and divided the profiles correctly, please CHECK with your teacher.

1) WHO? You and a classmate

2) WHAT? Use the information from step 3 and 4 to create a final product which you will present in class.

3) HOW?

a) Choose WHAT you want to do.

b) Some ideas:

- Movie (iMovie, animation, etc.)

- Presentation (Keynote, Prezi, etc.)

- Comic / Cartoon

- Diary

- (Role)play

- Interview

- Newspaper

c) CHECK with your teacher if your idea is suitable for this assignment.

d) Aim of your product should be to give an overview of all the information you have. (step 3 and 4)

1) HAND IN your own and personal 'Dutch Revolt' Google Document and your final product in Google Classroom.

2) PRESENT your final product in class. Your teacher will decide the order of the presentations.

Your teacher will grade your work and final product within ten working days after the presentation.
